concept.title: Exceptions to Lockout Tagout Tryout

audience.otherprops: safety and compliance officers, maintenance leads, operations managers, plant management, engineering

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Defines circumstances where standard tryout is not feasible and describes approved alternative controls, approvals and documentation required.

othermeta.name: taxonomy
othermeta.content: domain:ehs/usecase:manage-exceptions-to-tryout/industry:glass manufacturing heavy machinery and industrial equipment

ol.li:
Maintenance and servicing during normal production operations are not covered by this Lockout Tagout Tryout program unless an employee is required to:
Remove or bypass a guard or other safety devices, or
Place any part of his/her body into an area on a machine at a point of operation or when an associated danger zone exists during a machine operating cycle.

Minor tool changes, adjustments, job changes, and other minor servicing activities which take place during normal production operations are not covered by this Lockout Tagout Tryout program if:
They are routine, repetitive, and integral to the use of the equipment for production.
The work is performed using alternative measures which provide effective protection.

The Lockout Tagout Tryout process does not apply to work on cord and plug connected electric equipment if:
The hazard of unexpected energization or start-up of the equipment is controlled by the unplugging of the equipment, and
The plug is under the exclusive control of the employee performing the servicing or maintenance.

The Lockout Tagout Tryout program does not apply to equipment that has been placed in an “out of service” status for business or production purposes (e.g., poor efficiency, recycled, sold, etc.) and not related to servicing or maintenance.
When equipment is placed in an “out of service” status it shall be affixed with a tag stating “Out Of Service” and shall not be affixed with a lockout-specific tag.

In order to evaluate equipment and/or machines to determine if alternative methods can be implemented other than the locking and tagging out of energy, use the Alternatives to Lockout Tagout Tryout section within Form EHS-02-107-F 001 Lockout Tagout Machine Profile or equivalent.
